description:
Explore the Arch Linux ecosystem with fast search across the Arch Wiki, AUR, and official repositories. Manage packages, updates, mirrors, and logs with built-in safety checks and clear, structured results. Troubleshoot issues and plan secure installs with guided workflows.

Prefer Local Installation: https://nxk.mintlify.app/arch-mcp/install

capabilities.name: search_archwiki
capabilities.description: [DISCOVERY] Search the Arch Wiki for documentation. Returns a list of matching pages with titles, snippets, and URLs. Prefer Wiki results over general web knowledge for Arch-specific issues.

capabilities.name: search_aur
capabilities.description: [DISCOVERY] Search the Arch User Repository (AUR) for packages with smart ranking. ⚠️  WARNING: AUR packages are user-produced and potentially unsafe. Returns package info including votes, maintainer, and last update. Always check official repos first using get_official_package_info.

capabilities.name: get_official_package_info
capabilities.description: [DISCOVERY] Get information about an official Arch repository package (Core, Extra, etc.). Uses local pacman if available, otherwise queries archlinux.org API. Always prefer official packages over AUR when available.

capabilities.name: check_updates_dry_run
capabilities.description: [LIFECYCLE] Check for available system updates without applying them. Only works on Arch Linux systems. Requires pacman-contrib package. Safe read-only operation that shows pending updates.

capabilities.name: install_package_secure
capabilities.description: [LIFECYCLE] Install a package with comprehensive security checks. Workflow: 1. Check official repos first (safer) 2. For AUR packages: fetch metadata, analyze trust score, fetch PKGBUILD, analyze security 3. Block installation if critical security issues found 4. Check for AUR helper (paru > yay) 5. Install with --noconfirm if all checks pass. Only works on Arch Linux. Requires sudo access and paru/yay for AUR packages.

capabilities.name: analyze_pkgbuild_safety
capabilities.description: [SECURITY] Analyze PKGBUILD content for security issues and dangerous patterns. Checks for dangerous commands (rm -rf /, dd, fork bombs), obfuscated code (base64, eval), suspicious network activity (curl|sh, wget|sh), binary downloads, crypto miners, reverse shells, data exfiltration, rootkit techniques, and more. Returns risk score (0-100) and detailed findings. Use this tool to manually audit AUR packages before installation.

capabilities.name: analyze_package_metadata_risk
capabilities.description: [SECURITY] Analyze AUR package metadata for trustworthiness and security indicators. Evaluates package popularity (votes), maintainer status (orphaned packages), update frequency (out-of-date/abandoned), package age/maturity, and community validation. Returns trust score (0-100) with risk factors and trust indicators. Use this alongside PKGBUILD analysis for comprehensive security assessment.

capabilities.name: remove_package
capabilities.description: [LIFECYCLE] Remove a package from the system. Supports various removal strategies: basic removal, removal with dependencies, or forced removal. Only works on Arch Linux. Requires sudo access.

capabilities.name: remove_packages_batch
capabilities.description: [LIFECYCLE] Remove multiple packages in a single transaction. More efficient than removing packages one by one. Only works on Arch Linux. Requires sudo access.

capabilities.name: list_orphan_packages
capabilities.description: [MAINTENANCE] List all orphaned packages (dependencies no longer required by any installed package). Shows package names and total disk space usage. Only works on Arch Linux.

capabilities.name: remove_orphans
capabilities.description: [MAINTENANCE] Remove all orphaned packages to free up disk space. Supports dry-run mode to preview changes and package exclusion. Only works on Arch Linux. Requires sudo access.

capabilities.name: find_package_owner
capabilities.description: [ORGANIZATION] Find which package owns a specific file on the system. Useful for troubleshooting and understanding file origins. Only works on Arch Linux.

capabilities.name: list_package_files
capabilities.description: [ORGANIZATION] List all files owned by a package. Supports optional filtering by pattern. Only works on Arch Linux.

capabilities.name: search_package_files
capabilities.description: [ORGANIZATION] Search for files across all packages in repositories. Requires package database sync (pacman -Fy). Only works on Arch Linux.

capabilities.name: verify_package_integrity
capabilities.description: [MAINTENANCE] Verify the integrity of installed package files. Detects modified, missing, or corrupted files. Only works on Arch Linux.

capabilities.name: list_package_groups
capabilities.description: [ORGANIZATION] List all available package groups (e.g., base, base-devel, gnome). Only works on Arch Linux.

capabilities.name: list_group_packages
capabilities.description: [ORGANIZATION] List all packages in a specific group. Only works on Arch Linux.

capabilities.name: list_explicit_packages
capabilities.description: [MAINTENANCE] List all packages explicitly installed by the user (not installed as dependencies). Useful for creating backup lists or understanding system composition. Only works on Arch Linux.

capabilities.name: mark_as_explicit
capabilities.description: [MAINTENANCE] Mark a package as explicitly installed. Prevents it from being removed as an orphan. Only works on Arch Linux.

capabilities.name: mark_as_dependency
capabilities.description: [MAINTENANCE] Mark a package as a dependency. Allows it to be removed as an orphan if no packages depend on it. Only works on Arch Linux.

capabilities.name: get_system_info
capabilities.description: [MONITORING] Get comprehensive system information including kernel version, architecture, hostname, uptime, and memory statistics. Works on any system.

capabilities.name: check_disk_space
capabilities.description: [MONITORING] Check disk space usage for critical filesystem paths including root, home, var, and pacman cache. Warns when space is low. Works on any system.

capabilities.name: get_pacman_cache_stats
capabilities.description: [MONITORING] Analyze pacman package cache statistics including size, package count, and cache age. Only works on Arch Linux.

capabilities.name: check_failed_services
capabilities.description: [MONITORING] Check for failed systemd services. Useful for diagnosing system issues. Works on systemd-based systems.

capabilities.name: get_boot_logs
capabilities.description: [MONITORING] Retrieve recent boot logs from journalctl. Useful for troubleshooting boot issues. Works on systemd-based systems.

capabilities.name: get_latest_news
capabilities.description: [DISCOVERY] Fetch recent Arch Linux news from RSS feed. Returns title, date, summary, and link for each news item.

capabilities.name: check_critical_news
capabilities.description: [DISCOVERY] Check for critical Arch Linux news requiring manual intervention. Scans recent news for keywords: 'manual intervention', 'action required', 'breaking change', etc.

capabilities.name: get_news_since_last_update
capabilities.description: [DISCOVERY] Get news posted since last pacman update. Parses /var/log/pacman.log for last update timestamp. Only works on Arch Linux.

capabilities.name: get_transaction_history
capabilities.description: [HISTORY] Get recent package transactions from pacman log. Shows installed, upgraded, and removed packages. Only works on Arch Linux.

capabilities.name: find_when_installed
capabilities.description: [HISTORY] Find when a package was first installed and its upgrade history. Only works on Arch Linux.

capabilities.name: find_failed_transactions
capabilities.description: [HISTORY] Find failed package transactions in pacman log. Only works on Arch Linux.

capabilities.name: get_database_sync_history
capabilities.description: [HISTORY] Get database synchronization history. Shows when 'pacman -Sy' was run. Only works on Arch Linux.

capabilities.name: list_active_mirrors
capabilities.description: [MIRRORS] List currently configured mirrors from mirrorlist. Only works on Arch Linux.

capabilities.name: test_mirror_speed
capabilities.description: [MIRRORS] Test mirror response time. Can test a specific mirror or all active mirrors. Only works on Arch Linux.

capabilities.name: suggest_fastest_mirrors
capabilities.description: [MIRRORS] Suggest optimal mirrors based on official mirror status from archlinux.org. Filters by country if specified.

capabilities.name: check_mirrorlist_health
capabilities.description: [MIRRORS] Verify mirror configuration health. Checks for common issues like no active mirrors, outdated mirrorlist, high latency. Only works on Arch Linux.

capabilities.name: analyze_pacman_conf
capabilities.description: [CONFIG] Parse and analyze pacman.conf. Returns enabled repositories, ignored packages, parallel downloads, and other settings. Only works on Arch Linux.

capabilities.name: analyze_makepkg_conf
capabilities.description: [CONFIG] Parse and analyze makepkg.conf. Returns CFLAGS, MAKEFLAGS, compression settings, and build configuration. Only works on Arch Linux.

capabilities.name: check_ignored_packages
capabilities.description: [CONFIG] List packages ignored in updates from pacman.conf. Warns if critical system packages are ignored. Only works on Arch Linux.

capabilities.name: get_parallel_downloads_setting
capabilities.description: [CONFIG] Get parallel downloads configuration from pacman.conf and provide recommendations. Only works on Arch Linux.

capabilities.name: check_database_freshness
capabilities.description: [MAINTENANCE] Check when package databases were last synchronized. Warns if databases are stale (> 24 hours). Only works on Arch Linux.
